replies.bodyText: Remove on the list use index will be more efficient than buffer.remove.
replies.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText:
@wuchong  I agree with you, but I think we also should subtract buffer.currentTopNum =  buffer.currentTopNum - 1 after remove lastElement, So is it appropriate to add a method in TopNBuffer such as public void minusTopNum(int delta) { currentTopNum -= delta; },
we should call this method behind dataState.put(lastKey, new ArrayList<>(lastList)), what do you think it?
replies.author: lsyldliu

replies.bodyText: Good point. I just find that maybe we can use TopNBuffer#removeLast directly here.
replies.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: Good idea, I don't want to break the atomicity of TopNBuffer,  so I don't want to add new method which can operate currentTopNum directly in this class,  prefer to use TopNBuffer#removeLast
replies.author: lsyldliu

replies.bodyText: But, I find TopNBuffer#removeLast also iterate the list, the efficient problem also exist.
replies.author: lsyldliu

replies.bodyText: Yes. I think we should improve TopNBuffer#removeLast, we can call remove(index) and get(index) when it is a List.
replies.author: wuchong
